body_html:
Getting hit by this too on Ubuntu. On cv2.warpPerspective. What is weird about this is that the 1st epoch runs fine but the second epoch get stuck as soon as an item get transformed with cv2.warpPerspective from the getitem() Dataloader. There must be some kind of bad deadlock somewhere.

I ended up using: multiprocessing.set_start_method('spawn', force=True)
body_text:
Getting hit by this too on Ubuntu. On cv2.warpPerspective. What is weird about this is that the 1st epoch runs fine but the second epoch get stuck as soon as an item get transformed with cv2.warpPerspective from the getitem() Dataloader. There must be some kind of bad deadlock somewhere.
I ended up using: multiprocessing.set_start_method('spawn', force=True)
body:
Getting hit by this too on Ubuntu. On `cv2.warpPerspective`. What is weird about this is that the 1st epoch runs fine but the second epoch get stuck as soon as an item get transformed with `cv2.warpPerspective` from the `getitem()` Dataloader. There must be some kind of bad deadlock somewhere.

I ended up using: `multiprocessing.set_start_method('spawn', force=True)`
